alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Accomack and northern Northampton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cheriton, or 8 miles north of Cape Charles, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Exmore, Cape Charles, Nassawadox, Cheriton, Willis Wharf, Bay View, Eastville, Birdsnest, Machipongo, Franktown, Simpkins, Oyster, Quinby and Smith Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
